title: How do I get data off of Pixel 1 stuck in boot loop caused by over-full memory?
content:
I got multiple warnings that my memory was becoming full while I was on vacation and taking a lot of photos, but I wasn't able to take any of the pictures off to my computer because I didn't bring it with me. One day I attempted to take a picture, my phone froze and crashed, and when I tried to restart it, it just stayed stuck on the "G" screen with a loading bar beneath it. It will not progress past this screen. I have tried sideloading OTA using these instructions https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bz6x7k-VkpUJMlZ1aEliVnhMOHM/view and this OTA file "sailfish-ota-opm4.171019.021.p1-9fe2c539.zip". My phone is still stuck in the boot loop after sideloading and restarting. I have some very important photos on this phone that I would like to save. Is there any way to recover them? Even as far as having to dismantle the phone is okay with me. I would rather save the data than the device.

Thank you.
